variant.name: Browser
variant.summary: Handler for open browser windows and browsing data

variant.name: Lacros
variant.summary: Handler which calls cleanup on Lacros

variant.name: LacrosBrowser
variant.summary: Handler for open browser windows and browsing data on Lacros

variant.name: LacrosWebApp
variant.summary: Handler for web apps on Lacros

variant.name: Multipart
variant.summary: Content analysis of user action is done with the Multipart protocol.

variant.name: Resumable
variant.summary: Content analysis of user action is done with the Resumable protocol.

variant.name: File
variant.summary: Content analysis of uploaded or downloaded files.

variant.name: RemoteAccess
variant.summary: A CRD session where the admin has exclusive control of the ChromeOs device.

variant.name: RemoteSupport
variant.summary: A CRD session where the admin and the local user share control of the ChromeOs device.

variant.name: Unknown
variant.summary: When the CRD session type couldn't be determined.

variant.name: AffiliatedUserSession
variant.summary: The local user is affiliated to the organization.

variant.name: AutoLaunchedKioskSession
variant.summary: The local session is auto launched kiosk.

variant.name: GuestSession
variant.summary: The local guest session is not managed by an organization.

variant.name: ManagedGuestSession
variant.summary: The local guest session is managed by an organization.

variant.name: ManuallyLaunchedKioskSession
variant.summary: The local session is manually launched kiosk

variant.name: UnaffiliatedUserSession
variant.summary: The local user is not affiliated to the organization.

variant.name: Content
variant.summary: Content upload step of a Resumable request

variant.name: Metadata
variant.summary: Metadata upload step of a Resumable request.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AccountStatusCheckResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when user enters their account on license packged device during enrollment process.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AttributesTPMConsistency
histogram.summary: Consistency between TPM lock state and absence/presence of install attributes at boot.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentBucketDownloadTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Duration of the bucket download part of the auto-enrollment protocol. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-26 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentControllerTimeout
histogram.summary: Count the number of timeouts and successes for AutoEnrollmentController.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentHashDanceSuccessTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPrivateSetMembershipSuccessTime
histogram.summary:
Duration of the private set membership request to determine enrollment state of the device. Only recorded if it finished successfully.
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2022-04-10 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentProtocolTime{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Total duration time of the auto-enrollment protocol. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2022-01-09 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmDmServerRequestStatus{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Device management server request status for auto-enrollment PSM requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmRequestNetworkErrorCode{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment PSM requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentPsmResult{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
All possible PSM protocol results after it has executed successfully or terminated due to an error or timeout. This request is used to determine the initial enrollment state of the device. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-10-31 until 2021-11-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestNetworkErrorCode{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
Network error code (if applicable) for auto-enrollment requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-19 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.AutoEnrollmentRequestStatus{EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
histogram.summary:
URL fetcher status for auto-enrollment requests. {EnterpriseAutoEnrollmentType}
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2021-12-12 until 2022-07-15.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninIOS.SignedOutByPolicy
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a signed-in user is automatically signed out of the browser due to the BrowserSignin policy being set to 0 (sign-in disabled) by their organization. The sample is always recorded as true.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2021-06-30 to 2022-11-30; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninIOS.SignInInterruptedByPolicy
histogram.summary:
Recorded when a user is in the process of signing in to the browser, but is interrupted due to the BrowserSignin policy being set to 0 (sign-in disabled) by their organization. The sample is always recorded as true.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2021-06-30 to 2022-11-30; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.BrowserSigninPolicy
histogram.summary: Histogram for counting the BrowserSignin policy. This metric is recorded every 24 hours and at startup along with the full set of the enterprise policy rules that are in use.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMPolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting CBCM policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMPolicyRefresh
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing CBCM policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRealTimeReportEnqueue
histogram.summary: Recorded when real time report enter the queue. It indicates whether the report is pushed to the queue successfully or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommand.Executed
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed CBCM remote commands. The metric includes only signed CBCM remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination).

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received CBCM remote commands. The metric includes signed CBCM remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.CBCMRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting CBCM remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.CreateCertificate.Success.HasCert
histogram.summary: Captures whether the HTTP response body for the Profile certificate creation request had a certificate or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.CreatePrivateKey.Source
histogram.summary: Captures the source of a private key creation after it was created (e.g. TPM-backed or not) as part of the client certificate provisioning flow for a Profile.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.Provisioning.Error
histogram.summary: Captures a terminal error that occured when trying to provision a client certificate for a Profile.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.Provisioning.Store.Error
histogram.summary: Captures a terminal store error that occured when trying to provision a client certificate for a Profile.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.Provisioning.{ProvisioningScenario}.Outcome
histogram.summary: Captures whether the {ProvisioningScenario} provisioning scenario was successful or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.Provisioning.{ProvisioningScenario}.{ProvisioningOutcome}.Latency
histogram.summary: Captures how long a {ProvisioningOutcome} {ProvisioningScenario} provisioning scenario took.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.{UploadScenario}.ClientError
histogram.summary: Captures a client error that occured when trying to upload a Profile's public key for {UploadScenario}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ClientCertificate.Profile.{UploadScenario}.UploadCode
histogram.summary: Captures the HTTP response code for the upload of a Profile's public key for {UploadScenario}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudExtensionRequestUpdated
histogram.summary: Recorded when cloud extension request pending list is updated. Note that when multiple requests are added or removed together, there will be only one event recorded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudManagement.PolicyFetchingTime
histogram.summary: The amount of time for fetching cloud policies, measured from the moment the request object is created until the client receives the policy payload.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudManagementEnrollmentTokenLocation.Mac
histogram.summary: Records the enrollment token location when the token is loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingBasicRequestSize
histogram.summary: The proto size of the basic Chrome browser cloud management reporting request. When a report is separated into multiple requests, all of them contain the basic request.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingRequestCount
histogram.summary: The number of request for one Chrome browser cloud management report. A report is separated into multiple requests when it's too large.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingRequestSize
histogram.summary: The proto size of each Chrome browser cloud management reporting request. It includes the requests which are more than 5MB and discarded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingResponse
histogram.summary: The upload result for each cloud reporting request. Note that there may be multiple requests per report. Also, one request may creates multiple data point due to retry.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudReportingUploadTrigger
histogram.summary: The trigger detected by the ReportScheduler responsible that led to an attempt to upload an enterprise report.

histogram.name: Enterprise.CloudUserAffiliationStatus
histogram.summary: The cloud user affiliation status. Recorded once at the end of each policy fetch process where a cloud-managed user is involved.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DataProtection.NavigationFinished.URLVerdictSource
histogram.summary: Records where the realtime url lookup verdict is read from in the data protection navigation observer. It is logged once per navigation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountCount
histogram.summary: Logs the number of device local accounts on the device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device local account policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device local account policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyDeviceIdValidity2.{EnrollmentType}
histogram.summary: On ChromeOS, the result of the device ID validation in the device policy blob compared to the device ID from install attributes. Emitted every time the device policy was loaded or stored successfully after additional check for the presence of DM Token is done. This allows to filter out the cases of enrollment recovery.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2 counts only events of device local account policy invalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DevicePolicyRefresh3
histogram.summary:
Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing device policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.
As opposed to current histogram, Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyRefresh3 counts only events of refreshing device local account policies.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.Result
histogram.summary: Reports success/failure when a session is attempted.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.{Enterprise_CrdSessionType}.{Enterprise_UserSessionType}.Result
histogram.summary: Reports success/failure when a session is attempted for the {Enterprise_CrdSessionType} and {Enterprise_UserSessionType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Crd.{Enterprise_CrdSessionType}.{Enterprise_UserSessionType}.SessionDuration
histogram.summary: Reports duration of a successful session completed for the {Enterprise_CrdSessionType} and {Enterprise_UserSessionType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Executed{Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed device remote commands. The metric includes only signed device remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination). {Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.FetchSupportPacket.Failure
histogram.summary: Reports the failure reason of the FETCH_SUPPORT_PACKET remote command. It will be recorded by DeviceCommandFetchSupportPacketJob class when the command execution has completed with failure. It will indicate in which stage of execution had the failure (e.g. wrong command payload, error when exporting the generated support packet or enqueueing the LogUploadEvent to ReportQueue).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received device remote commands. The metric includes signed device remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary:
Events for counting device remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
Metric is similar to Enterprise.DevicePolicyInvalidations2. Device local account scope does not exist for remote commands so there is no metric for remote commands similar to Enterprise.DeviceLocalAccountPolicyInvalidations2.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSettings.MissingPolicyMitigated
histogram.summary: Recorded every time policy file is missing or corrupted on Chrome OS. Should be compared to Enterprise.DeviceSettings.UpdatedStatus as happens only if status is STORE_NO_POLICY and device being not managed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSettings.UpdatedStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded every time as DeviceSettingsProvider updates its current state. Used to compare rate of Enterprise.DeviceSettings.MissingPolicyMitigated event.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.CrowdStrike.Error
histogram.summary: Captures an error that occurred while trying to get signals from the CrowdStrike agent.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Failure.{Signal}.{ErrorType}Error
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever a {Signal} signal collection request failed with a {ErrorType} error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Request.{Signal}.Items
histogram.summary: Captures the number of items as part of the {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded when the collection request was received. This histogram applies only to parameterized signals.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.Success.{Signal}.Items
histogram.summary: Captures the number of items collected in a {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded only when the collection request was successful and the signal value represents a collection.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Outcome}.{Signal}.Latency
histogram.summary: Captures the signal collection latency for the {Signal} signal. Recorded only when the collection {Outcome}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Signal}.Delta
histogram.summary: Captures the number of delta between requested and returned items as part of the {Signal} signal collection response. Recorded when the collection request was completed. This histogram applies only to parameterized signals.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.Collection.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a device signal collection request {Variant} for a particular signal.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceSignals.UserPermission
histogram.summary: Recorded whenever a permission evaluation has been assessed for a particular user for whom device signals were requested.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.Funnel
histogram.summary: Various steps recorded when a device goes through the device trust connector attestation flow with a partner website.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.ResponseLatency.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Latency of a {Variant} attestation step in the overarching Device Trust connector's attestation flow. This measures the amount of time required to generate and return a response to the given challenge, which is effectively the last step in the overall attestation flow.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Attestation.Result
histogram.summary: Result of the attestation step in the overarching Device Trust connector's attestation flow. Logged whenever the attestation step finishes, success or failure, and right before the throttled request resumes.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.EnrollmentStatus
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device starts the device trust attestation flow with a partner website. This captures the enrollment status of the device where the attestation flow is happening.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Handshake.Result
histogram.summary: Recorded when a Device Trust handshake was completed between the browser and a server. This captures either the success or specific failure of the overall flow.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Inline.Attestation.PolicyLevel
histogram.summary: Policy levels enabled for the Device Trust connector during the DTC inline flow process. The inline flow can occur during a user navigation, and the policy level determines the content of the attestation services' challenge response.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.LoadPersistedKeyResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when a key loading attempt was made with an enum value representing either a successful attempt, or different possible errors.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.Signing.Latency.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Device Trust {Variant} key is successfully used to sign a payload. Measures the signing latency in milliseconds.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.TrustLevel
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Device Trust signing key is successfully loaded from persistence. This captures what trust level this key has, which in turn gives insights into how it was created (e.g. via a TPM or not).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.Type
histogram.summary: Recorded every time a Device Trust signing key is successfully loaded from persistence. This captures what algorithm this key was generated with.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Key.{Variant}Result
histogram.summary: Recorded every time the browser attempted to {Variant} a Device Trust signing key. This captures the result from this process.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.KeyRotationCommand.Error
histogram.summary: Recorded when the browser received a failed response when triggering a Device Trust key rotation command. The browser will then attempt to categorize the failure using the given enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.KeyRotationCommand.Error.Hresult
histogram.summary: Recorded when the browser failed to trigger a Device Trust key rotation command through the updater for an unknown reason. This will capture the unknown HRESULT returned via the COM APIs.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.KeyRotationCommand.ExitCode
histogram.summary: Recorded when the browser received a failed response when triggering a Device Trust key rotation command. The browser will then attempt to categorize the failure using the given enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Mac.KeychainOSStatus.{KeyType}.{Operation}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a failed OSStatus code is returned from a Keychain Services API for the {KeyType} keypair during a {Operation} operation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Mac.SecureEnclaveOperation.{KeyType}
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to issue an API that interacts with the Secure Enclave signing key in the {KeyType} key storage.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.ManagementService.Error
histogram.summary: Captures any terminal failures that occur in the Device Trust management service binary during the execution of a command (e.g. key rotation).

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Origin
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device starts the device trust attestation flow with a partner website. This captures if the attestation flow was triggered inside of a session or on the login screen.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.Persistence.{Operation}.Error
histogram.summary: Captures any terminal failures that occur during the process of creating, storing, and loading a Device Trust signing key pair during a key rotation.

variant.name: CheckPermission
variant.summary: Operation that checks the permissions for accessing the key storage

variant.name: CreateKeyPair
variant.summary: Operation that creates a new signing key pair

variant.name: LoadKeyPair
variant.summary: Operation that loads the key pair from the persistence storage

variant.name: StoreKeyPair
variant.summary: Operation that stores the key pair in persistence storage

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.PublicKeyUpload.URLLoaderNetError
histogram.summary: Net error recorded when a public key upload request failed to leave the client.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.Tries
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. Chrome will retry a fixed number of times until the operation either succeeds or fails. A value of 1 means the rotation worked on the first try.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.{Nonce}.Status
histogram.summary: Recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. {Nonce}

variant.name: NoNonce
variant.summary: This occurs right after the device is enrolled with CBCM.

variant.name: WithNonce
variant.summary: This occurs when a device receives a command from the admin console.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.RotateSigningKey.{Nonce}.UploadCode
histogram.summary: HTTP status code of the key upload request recorded when a device attempts to rotate its device trust signing key. {Nonce}

variant.name: NoNonce
variant.summary: This occurs right after the device is enrolled with CBCM.

variant.name: WithNonce
variant.summary: This occurs when a device receives a command from the admin console.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.SignalsDecorator.Latency.{Variant}
histogram.summary: Latency recorded when the {Variant} decorator(s) finish collecting their signals. Captures the amount of time required to collect the signals under this scope.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.SyncSigningKey.ClientError
histogram.summary: Captures any client-side errors that caused a key synchronization flow to fail.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DeviceTrust.SyncSigningKey.UploadCode
histogram.summary: HTTP status code of the key upload request recorded when a device issues a key synchronization request.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ActiveFileEventsCount
histogram.summary: Number of non-expired file events stored in the DlpFilesController::EventStorage. It is recorded each time an entry is added or updated.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.CaptureModeInitBlocked
histogram.summary: Recorded when capture mode initialization was blocked by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.CaptureModeInitWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user is warned by Data Leak Prevention before capture mode initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ClipboardReadBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a data read from the clipboard.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ConfidentialContentsCount
histogram.summary: Number of items stored in the DlpConfidentialContentsCache. It is recorded each time a new entry is cached.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DataTransferControllerStarted
histogram.summary: Recorded when DataTransferController is initialized, meaning that all clipboard and drag-n-drop operations will be affected by Data Leak Prevention checks.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DataTransferReportingTimeDiff
histogram.summary: Time difference between current and the latest sent Data Leak Prevention reporting events for data transfers for which sources and destinations are the same.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DlpPolicyPresent
histogram.summary: Recorded when non-empty Data Leak Prevention policy is present and due to that Data Leak Prevention infrastructure is initialized on the client.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.DragDropBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a drag-n-drop operation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.Adaptor
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error occurs during adaptor usage in the Data Leak Prevention daemon.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.DaemonInit
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error occurs while performing initialization operations in the Data Leak Prevention daemon.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.Fanotify
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error occurs during fanotify usage in the Data Leak Prevention daemon.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.FileDatabase
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error occurs while performing database operations in the Data Leak Prevention daemon.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.FilesPolicySetup
histogram.summary: Record whether an error occurs during the Data Leak Prevention files policy setup.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.Errors.ReportQueueNotReady
histogram.summary: Record whether a Data Leak Prevention event is not reported because of report queue setup issues.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FanotifyDeleteEventSupport
histogram.summary: Record whether the kernel supports fanotify mark filesystem.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FanotifyMarkFilesystemSupport
histogram.summary: Record whether the kernel supports fanotify delete events.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionBlocked2
histogram.summary: Records when a file action is blocked because of Data Leak Prevention policy Files restriction. Identifies which file action was blocked.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionBlockReviewed
histogram.summary: Records which file action blocked by Data Leak Prevention policy is reviewed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarned2
histogram.summary: Records when a file action is warned because of Data Leak Prevention policy Files restriction. Identifies which file action was warned.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Records which file action was warned because of Data Leak Prevention policy restrictions and proceeded by the user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarnReviewed
histogram.summary: Records which file action warning by Data Leak Prevention policy was reviewed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FileActionWarnTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records which file action was warned because of Data Leak Prevention policy and the warning timed out.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesAppOpenTimedOut
histogram.summary: Records True when opening the Files App to show a Data Leak Prevention dialog times out, and False when it successfully opens.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesBlockedCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of files blocked by Data Leak Prevention policy per file action.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesDaemonStarted
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention policy contains Files restrictions and DLP Files daemon is started because of that.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesDefaultFileAccess
histogram.summary: Record if we were not able to pin a source URL to a file open request and have to fallback on the default behaviour.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesUnknownAccessLevel
histogram.summary: Records the resolved Data Leak Prevention file access level every time an unknown unauthorized access is being resolved over IsDlpPolicyMatched.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.FilesWarnedCount
histogram.summary: Records the number of files warned by Data Leak Prevention policy per file action.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning for printing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrintingWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and printing is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.PrivacyScreenEnforced
histogram.summary: Recorded when privacy screen was enforced by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedBlockLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "block" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was blocked and reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedEventStatus
histogram.summary: Result of enqueueing Data Leak Prevention event to the reporting queue.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedReportLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "report" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedWarnLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "warn" level was reported. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ReportedWarnProceedLevelRestriction
histogram.summary: Recorded when Data Leak Prevention event with "warn" level was reported after a user proceeded with a restricted action. Identifies which restriction was reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.RestrictionConfigured
histogram.summary: Records which types of restrictions are present in Data Leak Prevention policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.SameFileEventTimeDiff
histogram.summary: Time difference between the current and the latest sent Data Leak Prevention file events for which inodes and destinations are the same.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenSharePausedOrResumed
histogram.summary: Recorded when screen share was paused (True) or resumed (False) by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning for a screen share.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenShareWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for a screen share, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and the screen share is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotBlocked
histogram.summary: Result of Data Leak Prevention evaluation for taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarned
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarnProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when the user proceeded with (True) or canceled (False) the action after a Data Leak Prevention warning shown at the capture mode initialization or before taking a screenshot or a video capture.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.ScreenshotWarnSilentProceeded
histogram.summary: Recorded when there is a "warn" level Data Leak Prevention evaluation for initiating capture mode, or taking a screenshot or a video capture, but it is caused by the content that the user was already warned about and decided to proceed, so no new warning is shown and the screen share is silently allowed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Dlp.VideoCaptureInterrupted
histogram.summary: Recorded when video capture was interrupted by Data Leak Prevention.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMServerCloudPolicyRequestStatus{EnterpriseDMServerCloudPolicyRequest}
histogram.summary:
Records the returned status of fetching cloud policies from the dmserver.
Recorded when receiving the response from the dmserver upon request completion with policy type {EnterpriseDMServerCloudPolicyRequest}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.DMServerRequestSuccess{EnterpriseDMServerRequest}
histogram.summary: Number of retries the client did to execute a DeviceManagementServer request. It's recorded after the request has been completed, either successfully after 0 or more retries, with a failure (too many retries or non-retriable error) or with a server error. {EnterpriseDMServerRequest}

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledDevicePolicyPresent
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policy from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields an enterprise policy. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrolledPolicyHasDMToken
histogram.summary: Whether loading of device policies from file on an enterprise-enrolled (checked against install_attributes.pb) Chrome OS device yields a PolicyData message with a DMToken. Filled once during session startup, after first successful device policy read.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Enrollment
histogram.summary: Events related to device enrollment on new installs of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentAttestationBased
histogram.summary:
Events related to attestation-based enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-12-05 to 2022-02-01. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForced
histogram.summary: Events related to forced re-enrollment (FRE) of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedAttestationBased
histogram.summary: Events related to attestation-based re-enrollment (Auto RE) of Chrome OS devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitial
histogram.summary: Events related to forced initial enrollment of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitialAttestationBased
histogram.summary: Events related to attestation-based initial enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedInitialManualFallback
histogram.summary: Events related to manual fallback from attestation-based initial enrollment (Zero-Touch) of Chrome OS devices during the first startup of a device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentForcedManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual fallback from attestation-based re-enrollment (Auto RE) of Chrome OS devices.
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-12-05 to 2022-02-01. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentNudge.PolicyFetchResult
histogram.summary: Recorded when we fetch the value of enrollment nudge policy. Tracks the value of the policy or the absence of it in the server response.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentNudge.UserAction
histogram.summary: Tracks user actions on the enrollment nudge pop-up on the Gaia screen. Recorded when user clicks on one of the buttons there.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRecovery
histogram.summary: Events related to Chrome OS enterprise enrollment recovery. Note that this only covers cases in which prior to recovery, UMA stats are enabled by policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRemoteDeployment
histogram.summary:
Events related to Remote Deployment enrollments, a subset of token-based enrollment. As of writing, only Flex devices use Remote Deployment.
Events are recorded in response to a successful or failed enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRemoteDeploymentManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual fallback from Remote Deployment enrollment, a subset of token-based enrollment.
Events are recorded in response to a successful or failed enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRollbackAttestation
histogram.summary:
Events related to attestation based re-enrollment after enterprise rollback.
Events are recorded during enrollment after rollback and types are listed in the MetricEnrollment enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentRollbackManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual re-enrollment after enterprise rollback. This is used when attestation based enrollment fails.
Events are recorded during enrollment after rollback and types are listed in the MetricEnrollment enum.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Cancel
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment was cancelled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Failure
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTime.Success
histogram.summary: Elapsed time from *after* GAIA login until enrollment succeeded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTokenBased
histogram.summary:
Events related to token-based enrollment on ChromeOS devices. As of writing only Flex devices use token-based enrollment, to perform Flex Auto Enrollment.
Events are recorded in response to a successful or failed enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.EnrollmentTokenBasedManualFallback
histogram.summary:
Events related to manual fallback from token-based enrollment on ChromeOS devices. As of writing only Flex devices use token-based enrollment, to perform Flex Auto Enrollment.
Events are recorded in response to a successful or failed enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IdleTimeoutPolicies.ActionTime.{ActionType}
histogram.summary: The time taken to run {ActionType} on idle timeout.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IdleTimeoutPolicies.IdleTimeoutCase
histogram.summary: On mobile: whether idle timeout happened while the app was already foregrounded or backgrounded. The metric is recorded when idle timeout is detected while the app is foreground and when idle timeout is detected on reforeground or start-up.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IdleTimeoutPolicies.IdleTimeoutDialogEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to the timeout dialog shown to the user for 30 seconds before idle timeout actions run. The user either responds by clicking the button in the dialog indicating activity or the dialog expires and actions run.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IdleTimeoutPolicies.IdleTimeoutLaunchScreenEvent
histogram.summary: Tracks events related to the launch screen shown on mobile when idle timeout actions run on app foreground. The launch screen can be dismissed after actions complete or after it has reached its expiry deadline.

histogram.name: Enterprise.IdleTimeoutPolicies.Success.{ActionType}
histogram.summary: Whether the {ActionType} ran successfully or not. The metric is recorded as true if the action runs successfully and false if the action fails.

histogram.name: Enterprise.InstallAttributes.ValidOnEnrolledDevice
histogram.summary: Whether the install attributes are valid on the enrolled device. Device is determined to be enrolled based on the device policy. The check is performed at device boot.

histogram.name: Enterprise.InvalidDevicePolicyFilesStatus
histogram.summary: Chrome OS only. Result of checking if device policy files are valid when reading the device policy data.

histogram.name: Enterprise.KeySignatureVerification
histogram.summary: Result of key signature verification from the policy data.

histogram.name: Enterprise.LoginApiCleanup.{CleanupHandler}.Success
histogram.summary: ChromeOS only. Records if cleanup handler succeeded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.LoginApiCleanup.{CleanupHandler}.Timing
histogram.summary: ChromeOS only. Records the duration the cleanup handler took.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.DMTokenDeletion
histogram.summary: Records whether browser unenrollment via DMToken deletion completed successfully after attempting to delete the token.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.RequestSuccessTime
histogram.summary: Time since the enrollment request was made until a successful enrollment response is returned from the server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.Result
histogram.summary: The result of machine level user cloud policy enrollment.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.StartupDialog
histogram.summary: Records whether the machine level user cloud policy enrollment dialog is shown to the user and the action they took.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.StartupDialogTime
histogram.summary: The length of time the machine level user cloud policy enrollment dialog was visible to the user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.MachineLevelUserCloudPolicyEnrollment.UnenrollSuccess
histogram.summary: Records whether a browser unenrollment was completed successfully by writing an invalid DMToken to storage or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagedScreensaver.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records whether the managed screensaver is enabled. Recorded for managed devices when the sign-in screen is displayed, on every user login, and every time the ScreensaverLockScreenEnabled or DeviceScreensaverLoginScreenEnabled policy is updated.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagedScreensaver.EngagementTime.Slideshow
histogram.summary: Among users with managed screensaver enabled, records the length of each session for Slideshow. The metric is emitted when an ambient mode session ends.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagedScreensaver.ImageCount
histogram.summary: Records the count of images downloaded in cache to display in the managed screensaver. Recorded every time the policy list changes and images are deleted from the cache or downloaded to the cache.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagedScreensaver.ImageDownloadResult
histogram.summary: Records the result after attempting to download an image for the managed screensaver. Emitted on every image download operation.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ManagedScreensaver.StartupTime.Slideshow
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time it takes for the managed screensaver to start. This includes tasks such as getting the list of downloaded images, checking that the list has a minimal amount of images, decoding them, etc. Note this measurement does not include the lock screen inactivity timeout. The metric would be emitted when the first two images are loaded successfully.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.Interception.Funnel
histogram.summary: Records the occurrance of each crucial step of the OIDC enrollment flow before profile registration.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.Interception.Result
histogram.summary: Tracks the results of OIDC enrollment flow when it finishes before profile registration.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.ProfileCreation.Funnel.{IdentityType}
histogram.summary: Records the occurrance of each crucial step of the OIDC enrollment flow with a {IdentityType} 3P identity after profile registration.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.ProfileCreation.Result.{IdentityType}
histogram.summary: Tracks the results of OIDC enrollment flow with a {IdentityType} 3P identity when it finishes after profile registration.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.{IdentityType}.PolicyFetchLatency.{Result}
histogram.summary: Latency of a {Result} policy fetch operation for an OIDC profile with {IdentityType} 3P identity during enrollment, recorded when the fetch response is received.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OidcEnrollment.{IdentityType}.RegistrationLatency.{Result}
histogram.summary: Latency of a {IdentityType} OIDC profile registration operation when OIDC profiles are first getting created. Failed attempts will always be classified as undecided since we won't know whether it's dasher-based. Recorded when the registration response is received.

histogram.name: Enterprise.OnBulkDataEntry.DataSize
histogram.summary: Records the size (in bytes) of data that might have been scanned by the OnBulkDataEntry Enterprise Connector. It is logged once per user action that would trigger this Connector.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PlatformAuth.GetAuthData.Count
histogram.summary: The number of proof-of-possession cookies retrieved from the platform to authenticate the user to their IdP/STS. Recorded once per successful fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PlatformAuth.GetAuthData.FailureHresult
histogram.summary: The HRESULT returned by either CoCreateInstance or GetCookieInfoForUri when trying to fetch proof-of-possession cookies from the platform to authenticate the user to their IdP/STS.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PlatformAuth.GetAuthData.{Result}Time
histogram.summary: The elapsed time for a fetch of proof-of-possession cookies from the platform to authenticate the user to their IdP/STS to {Result}. Recorded once per fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies
histogram.summary: A set of enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies.Sources
histogram.summary:
Record summary of sources of all policies. It's recorded ever 24 hours and at startup.
This does not include user cloud policy and some special policy sources like enterprise_default.

histogram.name: Enterprise.Policies.{PolicyLevel}
histogram.summary: A set of {PolicyLevel} enterprise policy rules that are in use. This is recorded for each {PolicyLevel} policy every 24 hours and at startup, if the last recording was earlier than a day before.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations
histogram.summary: Events for counting user policy invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that a policy has been updated and should be refreshed. Payloads provide context about the policy update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyLoadStatus
histogram.summary: Load status from the policy loaders which pull policy settings from the underlying platform, such as Windows Group Policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyRefresh2
histogram.summary: Events measuring effectiveness of refreshing user policy when invalidations are received from a service. For each refresh, indicates whether the policy changed, and whether the policy was invalidated at the time of the refresh.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyServiceInitTime{Scope}{PolicyCountSuffix}

variant.name: .Machine
variant.summary: Recorded for the top-level PolicyService (either browser or device) on startup.

variant.name: .User
variant.summary: Recorded for profile-level PolicyService objects, each time a profile is created.
Recorded regardless of the number of policies it contains.

variant.name: .With_1_to_50_Policies
variant.summary: Recorded only for PolicyService objects that with 1-50 policies.

variant.name: .With_51_to_100_Policies
variant.summary: Recorded only for PolicyService objects that with 51-100 policies.

variant.name: .With_101_Plus_Policies
variant.summary: Recorded only for PolicyService objects that with 101+ policies.

variant.name: .WithoutPolicies
variant.summary: Recorded only for PolicyService objects that without any policy.

variant.name: .WithPolicies
variant.summary: Recorded only for PolicyService objects that with at least one policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUI.ButtonUsage.{ButtonType}
histogram.summary:
The total number of time {ButtonType} button has been clicked for each time chrome://policy page is opened. Recorded once the page is closed. Export To JSON button is not available on iOS.
Note that we won't be able to collect the data if the page is not closed normally. For example, browser is crash or shutdown by OS which often happens on mobile platforms.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.Device
histogram.summary: Time since last device policy fetch. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.MachineLevelUser
histogram.summary: Time since last machine level user policy fetch.. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUpdatePeriod.User
histogram.summary: Time since last user policy fetch. Emitted when policies are loaded.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PolicyUserVerification
histogram.summary: Tracking the results of policy user verification.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileAffiliation.IsAffiliated
histogram.summary: Whether the current profile is affiliated. Recorded for each active profile every 7 days and upon profile policy service initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileAffiliation.UnaffiliatedReason
histogram.summary: The reason why the current profile is not affiliated. Recorded for each unaffiliated active profile every 7 days and upon profile policy service initialization.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileIdentifier.Error
histogram.summary: Recorded in the event of failures during the profile identifier generation action.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileIdentifier.Status
histogram.summary: Records whether the profile identifier generation action was successful or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileSeparation.DasherPolicyFetch.HttpResponse
histogram.summary: The Http statuses returned by the server when trying to get the ManagedAccountsSigninRestriction policy value for individual dasher accounts. This is recorded after trying to the the policy value, when the status is available.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ProfileSeparation.DasherPolicyFetch.NetworkError
histogram.summary: The network errors that happen when trying to get the ManagedAccountsSigninRestriction policy value for individual dasher accounts. This is recorded every time after trying to the the policy value.

histogram.name: Enterprise.PublicSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A public session starts when a user signs in using the policy configured public account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length rounded down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.RegularUserSession.SessionLength
histogram.summary: A regular user session starts when a user signs in using their user account. It stops when the user signs out. Session length is the duration between the start and stop events. It is recorded during signing out and reported on the next chrome run. This metric tracks the recorded session length on an enrolled device rounded down to the nearest 10-minute bucket and capped at 24 hours.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ReportingEventUploadFailure
histogram.summary: Failures to upload reporting events to the reporting server bucketed by event type.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ReportingEventUploadSuccess
histogram.summary: Reporting events successfully uploaded to the reporting server bucketed by event type.

histogram.name: Enterprise.ResumableRequest.{ResumableRequestCheckType}Check.{ContentAnalysisRequestType}.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of a {ResumableRequestCheckType} check part of a broader {ContentAnalysisRequestType} Resumable request. It is logged once per user action that would trigger this Connector.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SafeSites.Latency
histogram.summary: The latency of the request to the SafeSites API to classify URLs for users with the SafeSitesFilterBehavior policy. This is measured once per classified URL that requires a network request (URLs returned from the cache are not recorded).

histogram.name: Enterprise.SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage.PolicyFetch.ResponseLatency
histogram.summary:
Latency of a SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage policy fetch request. This measures the amount of time required to fetch the policy value of SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage from the Secure Connect API. This is recorded when a user account is added as a secondary account (in-session).
Warning: this histogram was expired from 2023-10-04 to 2023-12-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SecondaryGoogleAccountUsage.PolicyFetch.Status
histogram.summary: Tracks the result of UserCloudSigninRestrictionPolicyFetcher::GetSecondaryGoogleAccountUsage. This is recorded when a user account is added as a secondary account (in-session).

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.LocalStorage.Enabled
histogram.summary: Records whether local storage is enabled (default) or disabled by policy.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.LocalStorage.Misconfigured
histogram.summary: Records whether SkyVault is misconfigured: Local file storage is disabled, and the DownloadsDirectory policy, which also determines the default location for the Files app, is not set to a cloud location (e.g. Google Drive). This may cause the Files app to display incorrect folder information.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.Reset
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration of local files is reset during session initialization, due to policy changing since the last session to either allow local storage or disable the migration.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.Retry
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration of local files is retried after some non-fatal errors.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.WriteAccessError
histogram.summary: Recorded when an error occurs while setting the local storage write access.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.DialogAction
histogram.summary: Records user interactions with the migration dialog displayed 24 hours before the scheduled migration of local files to {CloudProvider}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.DialogShown
histogram.summary: Recorded when initiating the display of the migration information dialog. A value of "true" indicates the dialog was shown to the user. A value of "false" indicates the dialog was not shown, typically because a previous dialog was already displayed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.Enabled
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration to {CloudProvider} is enabled and all policies are configured properly, i.e. local storage is blocked, migration destination is set to {CloudProvider} and the required cloud storage is enabled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.Failed
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider} fails, i.e. when at least one file couldn't be uploaded to the cloud due to a non retryable error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.Misconfigured
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider} cannot proceed because the policies to enable the required cloud storage aren't set properly.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.Stopped
histogram.summary: Recorded when SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider} is stopped due to policy update to allow local storage, disable migration, or change the target cloud provider.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.UploadError
histogram.summary: Records upload errors that occur during SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.WrongState
histogram.summary: Recorded when an unexpected state transition happens during SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider}. Records the unexpected state value.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.Migration.{CloudProvider}.WrongStateContext
histogram.summary: Recorded when an unexpected state transition happens during SkyVault migration of local files to {CloudProvider}. Records the context in which the wrong state error occurred.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.{Action}.DeleteError
histogram.summary: Recorded when deleting the local file fails following a successful copy to the cloud storage.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SkyVault.{Action}.OneDrive.SignInError
histogram.summary: Recorded when sign in to OneDrive, required to complete file upload initiated by {Action}, fails. Note that this also captures sign-in requests cancelled by the user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.DeviceIdentifierStatus
histogram.summary: Captures state of device identifiers during state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.Enabled
histogram.summary: Captures situations when state determination is enabled.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.IsInitialByState.{State}
histogram.summary: Tracks whether state {State} returned by the server was initial (true), i.e. device is not enrolled into any domain because it is brand new or has been deprovisioned, or secondary (false), i.e. device is already managed and needs to retrieve its state because it has been powerwashed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.OnFlex
histogram.summary: Captures situations when state determination takes place on Flex devices.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.OwnershipStatus
histogram.summary: Captures ownership state of device during state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.PsmReportedAvailableState
histogram.summary: Tracks whether PSM has reported that state is available during state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.StateKeys.RetrievalErrorType
histogram.summary: Tracks the final errors due to which state keys failed to be retrieved. Errors which are hidden by the retries are not reported.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.StateReturned
histogram.summary: Tracks whether state request returned state during state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.Status
histogram.summary: Captures the status of state determination: whether it is enabled and why.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.StepDuration.{Step}
histogram.summary: Tracks the duration of the {Step} as part of state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.TotalDuration
histogram.summary: Tracks the total duration of state determination.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.TotalDurationByState.{State}
histogram.summary: Tracks the total duration of state determination when it results in {State} state.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.{RequestType}Request.DmStatusCode
histogram.summary: Device management server request status for {RequestType} requests to Device Management server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.StateDetermination.{RequestType}Request.NetworkErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error code for {RequestType} requests to Device Management server.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemFeaturesDisableList
histogram.summary: Shows which system features are set to be disabled by SystemFeaturesDisableList policy. Recorded when the policy preference is updated with a new system feature. No-op updates aren't counted.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WMI.{Signal}.ParsingError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever parsing of {Signal} from WMI results failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WMI.{Signal}.QueryError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever collection of {Signal} from WMI failed with a query error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WSC.AntiVirus.ParsingError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever parsing of AntiVirus info from WSC results failed.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.WSC.AntiVirus.QueryError
histogram.summary: Captures the actual error whenever collection of AntiVirus info from WSC failed with a query error.

histogram.name: Enterprise.SystemSignals.Collection.{Signal}.ParsingError.Rate
histogram.summary: Captures the response parsing error rate whenever collecting {Signal}.

histogram.name: Enterprise.TimeToUnthrottlePolicyInit
histogram.summary:
Duration between when the construction of the policy stack for a user profile starts and when its initialization gets unthrottled.
Only reported on ChromeOS Ash, only for managed users who are primary users in the given session. The values are capped at around 5 seconds, and timeouts are reported as this upper boundary value as well.

histogram.name: Enterprise.TokenBasedEnrollmentOobeConfig.{OobeConfigSource}.Success
histogram.summary:
Records the result of a token-based enrollment that was triggered by the following OOBE config source: {OobeConfigSource}.
Events are recorded in response to a successful or failed token-based enrollment attempt.

variant.name: PackagingTool
variant.summary: OOBE config created by an image token packaging tool

variant.name: RemoteDeployment
variant.summary: OOBE config created during remote deployment

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserInfoFetch.HttpErrorCode
histogram.summary:
Records the http error code when there is a network error that comes with a http error code.
Recorded at the end of an user info fetch if there is a network error that comes with a http error code.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserInfoFetch.Status
histogram.summary:
Records the status of fetching user info when doing registration for user policy.
Recorded at the end of each user info fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicy.Count
histogram.summary:
Records the number of user policies that are active when using a managed account.
Recorded once during the profile's browsing session on the first policy update after signing in with a managed account.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.ChildUser.OAuthTokenError
histogram.summary: Failure reason for OAuth token fetch for child user.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.InitialFetch.OAuth2Error
histogram.summary:
Service error during OAuth2 access token fetch.
There is a gap in data as the histogram was expired from 2022-03-01 till 2023-02-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserPolicyChromeOS.ReregistrationResult
histogram.summary: Re-registration results after failed policy fetch.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommand.Executed{Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}
histogram.summary: Events for counting status of executed user remote commands. The metric includes only signed user remote commands. Reports a final status of finished remote command (e.g. success, failure or termination). {Enterprise_RemoteCommandType}

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommand.Received
histogram.summary: Events for counting received user remote commands. The metric includes signed user remote commands, both valid and invalid. Valid remote command is counted by its type. Invalid remote command is counted by a reason why it is considered invalid (e.g. unknown type or duplication).

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserRemoteCommandInvalidations
histogram.summary:
Events for counting user remote commands invalidations received with and without payloads. Invalidations indicate that there is a remote command to execute. Payloads provide context about the remote commands update, but may be absent if dropped by the invalidation service.
Metric is similar to Enterprise.PolicyInvalidations.

histogram.name: Enterprise.UserSession.Logins
histogram.summary: Tracks the sign-in events on an enrolled device.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VerifiedAccess.SAML.DeviceTrustMatchesEndpoints
histogram.summary: Recorded when building a response for a challenge from Verified Access server for remote attestation during SAML authentication. This captures if Device Trust is configured alongside Verified Access for the current endpoint or not.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdCheck
histogram.summary:
The status code (exit code or signal) from sanity check of RW_VPD read and matching the contents with data from dump_vpd_log (Chrome OS).
There is a gap in data as the histogram was expired from 2020-07-05 till 2023-02-09.

histogram.name: Enterprise.VpdUpdateStatus
histogram.summary: The status code (exit code or signal) from VPD update operation (Chrome OS).

histogram.name: Enterprise.{ContentAnalysisProtocol}Request.{ContentAnalysisRequestType}.Duration
histogram.summary: Records the duration of scanning requests, parametrized by the protocol used and the type of content that's uploaded. It is logged once per user action that would trigger this Connector.

histogram.name: Enterprise.{ContentAnalysisProtocol}Request.{ContentAnalysisRequestType}.Result
histogram.summary: Records the result of scanning requests, parametrized by the protocol used and the type of content that's uploaded. It is logged once per user action that would trigger this Connector.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.AzureADJoinStatusCheckTime
histogram.summary: Time elapsed for checking the Azure AD join status. This is only recorded once during the first successful join status check.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.EnrollementRecoveryOnBoot
histogram.summary: The action taken on boot when enrollment recovery is marked in the local state.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InDomain
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is part of an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidJsonPolicies
histogram.summary:
A set of policy rules that failed validation due to unparsable JSON, or JSON that did not match the schema. This validation happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.
The histogram was expired (not recording data) from 2020-06-18 until 2021-03-15 and from 2021-07-01 to 2022-10-23.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPolicies
histogram.summary: A set of policy rules that were ignored due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.InvalidPoliciesDetected
histogram.summary: The number of disabled policy entries on Windows due to integrity violations while parsing the policy data which happens on start-up and when the policy has changed.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsDomainJoined
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is joined to an AD domain. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsEnterpriseUser
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is considered an enterprise user. An enterprise user is either in a domain, either local or cloud via AAD. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsFullyManaged2
histogram.summary: On Android (OS version Lollipop+): Whether the device has a "device owner" app installed. This check is performed once on application start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsJoinedToAzureAD
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is joined to an Azure AD domain or the user has added one or more work/school accounts to their login session. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsLocalMachine
histogram.summary: Whether the full machine name is the same as the short one, identifying a local machine. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsLocalUser
histogram.summary: Whether the currently logged in user is a local user or not, based on its SAM compatible user name and machine name. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsManaged2
histogram.summary: On Windows: Whether the machine is managed via MDM. On macOS: Whether Chrome found a file of managed policies to follow. On Android (OS version Lollipop+): Whether the device has a profile owner app. This check is performed once on application start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.IsManagedOrEnterpriseDevice
histogram.summary: Whether the machine is managed or part of an enterprise. This includes devices that are either in a domain or managed via MDM. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsCurrentUserDomainUser
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the current user has an enterprise identity in Open Directory. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsDeviceDomainJoined
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the machine is joined to a domain. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.Mac.IsDeviceMDMEnrolledNew
histogram.summary: On the Mac: Whether the machine is managed via MDM, with data obtained via a new method (profiles) that is only available in 10.13.4 or later. This check is performed once at start-up.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.OSType
histogram.summary: The rough Windows suite we are running on. This check is performed once at start-up on Windows. The histogram was removed in 108 and reinstated in 111.

histogram.name: EnterpriseCheck.WindowsProfileType
histogram.summary: The Windows profile type of the current user. This is obtained by calling the GetProfileType API once at start-up on Windows.

histogram.name: SkyVault.LocalUserFilesCleanupCount
histogram.summary: The number of times cleanup of local files was initiated after user session startup. Recorded at every time accumulating number of previous calls in this session.
